title: Phrack Pro-Phile XXI: Modem Master
historical_context: This article provides a glimpse into the early days of hacking and phreaking culture, highlighting the experiences of a prominent figure in the community during the 1980s.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, security professionals, and those interested in hacker culture history.
short_summary: This Pro-Phile features Modem Master, a.k.a. Napoleon Solo, detailing his journey into hacking and phreaking, his memorable experiences, and his reflections on the community.
summary:
In this installment of Phrack Pro-Phile, Taran King presents a profile of Modem Master, also known as Napoleon Solo, who began his hacking journey in the early 1980s. The article chronicles his introduction to the world of phreaking through his first modem and the connections he made with other enthusiasts. Modem Master shares anecdotes about his experiences on various bulletin boards and the friendships he formed, particularly with notable figures like King Blotto and Lord Kahz. His narrative captures the excitement and camaraderie of the early hacking community, as well as the challenges he faced as a young hacker navigating this underground world.

Modem Master reflects on his regrets about leaving the phreaking scene and expresses a desire to reconnect with the community. He emphasizes the importance of genuine knowledge and skills in hacking, distancing himself from those who exploit credit cards and other malicious activities. The article serves as both a personal memoir and a commentary on the evolution of hacker culture, showcasing the passion and dedication of individuals like Modem Master who contributed to the rich history of hacking and phreaking.
